text: When you're waiting for something good to happen,
it can feel like time is dragging on.
But when you want it to slow down,
it goes by in the blink of an eye.
♪ Now hold on, let me finish ♪
The odd part is time isn't real.
It's a concept imagined by scientists
of the earth around the sun.
♪ I'll write an anthem worth repeating ♪
So why do we put so much importance
on something that's just a theory?
Hey, do you two want to come over
You know, Owen and I are trying to establish our own traditions
with Leo, just give him a little bit of normalcy
Before his mother/sister comes home from rehab?
Well, kids can make anything normal,
Uh, I start my ICU rotation tomorrow,
and I was wondering if you have any advice on... that.
Well, first of all, Schmitt, don't call them "that."
Sorry, I just mean, it's so... emotional in there.
Well, it's the ICU, and she's been here for a month.
We don't know when she'll wake up
or even if she'll wake up.
You know, it's brutal, and it's depressing.
And it can make you feel like you're going insane.
You are going to watch Natasha very closely.
You will examine her every day.
If there's any change, any type of change,
And you should go outside on your breaks,
because you can feel like you're losing
all sense of time in here.
Ice skate to the tibia. You?
Ouch. Wife had a hell of a concussion.
Most wonderful time of the year, right?
What are you guys doing for Christmas?
Oh, you know, Leo's too young to absorb any of it.
But, I think we're gonna do presents and cocoa
And Amelia has to go to rehab to visit Betty. Yeah.
We're having Christmas dinner tomorrow night,
and Amelia wanted me to invite you.
I'm... I'm covering for you in the pit, remember?
Of course. And thank you, again.
We're gonna find our own traditions, too.
I mean, I don't think we've ever had a chief
I did something nice, and you're mocking me
- for it. - Oh, wait! Did you tell her?
We're having a New Year's Eve party.
I know. You should invite Link.
I mean, I already invited him,
but y-you should ask him to be your date,
'cause I already told him that you would.
- Jo... - Ooh, sorry. Ohh! Oh, my...
Hi. Um, I-I was just leaving,
and it looks like you are, too.
Do you want to take our hams out
- for a drink? - Oh, that sounds amazing,
but I have to get home because it's Christmas Eve.
I have to put the kids to bed so Santa can come.
Oh, you know, actually, the Karevs are having
a very classy New Year's Eve party.
She can have a plus one.
- You're supposed to read my tone. - Read your what? - Jo,
I can handle my own love life.
- Thanks for the ham, Chief. - You're welcome.
Cookies for Santa, in case you don't feel like baking later.
Link is spending his Christmas Eve
visiting kids in the cancer ward.
You're mocking him for doing something even nicer.
You should take a look at that.
We'll see you New Year's Eve.
You are in a love triangle.
There's no love. There's no triangle.
Unless, of course, the ham, the cookies, and I are a triangle.
She's totally in a love triangle.
- Uh, sorry I didn't call first. - Hey.
Just, uh... just wanted to drop these off for Tuck
for in the morning from me.
Uh... Uh, but I put your name on all the gifts I got him.
I-I don't remember us going shopping together.
I just didn't want him to think that...
You called a time-out on our marriage?
Uh, thank you for the gifts.
I'll make sure that he opens them.
Uh, what are you... Wait. Where are you gonna be tomorrow?
On call. You know, Christmas is a big day for us.
Uh, maybe I'll see you in the pit.
Maybe don't sound so hopeful that somebody gets injured
"We Wish You a Merry Christmas" plays...
I play a mean Gin Rummy.
Oh, you don't want to do that unless you want to lose.
I am the master of Gin Rummy
I'm sorry, kids. I'm just exhausted.
Would I be a party pooper if I just went to bed?
Of course, Mom. Get your rest.
Couldn't even chase Harriet around that tree this morning.
Thank you so much for taking care of Christmas dinner.
I've just been no help at all.
We have Christmas dinner catered every year, Mom.
There's no reason to change that.
No, I can make it to my bed on my own.
She doesn't let me help her do anything.
It was fine. A little boring.
I kinda wished you were there.
I'll come next year, and I'll bring some Chanukkah gelt.
Hey, uh, Dr. Shepherd asked me to come check on Natasha.
Oh, my God, it's Natasha. She's...
Thank you, thank you, thank you.
I'm saying it a lot for the both of us.
She is now A&O times three.
Cardio and pulmonary... She's on a vent
and has an open thoracostomy for empyema drainage.
and her pelvis was fixed internally.
When will she be able to talk?
We're working on decreasing her vent settings first.
We also have to get her nutrition up.
She's weak and has been through quite a lot.
We can close the thoracostomy today, though,
since her lungs are doing so much better.
Natasha, we need you to get strong for us.
I'm gonna get you up and out of that bed soon, okay?
Let's make sure the respiratory therapist
You may get that planetarium wedding yet.
At this point, I'd settle for a courthouse.
When are you gonna stop stringing him along, huh?
Link... he likes you, and you keep giving him false hope.
Oh, please. We both know it is.
Or is that like, "Oh, come to this party,"
and we'll make eyes at each other over the punch,
but I'm not really brave enough to talk to you in public"?
I've been called a lot of things.
"Not brave enough" isn't one of them.
Oh, ew. Please don't talk about my hair.
Yeah, he's teething like crazy, but he's good.
not as much as I miss drugs, but yeah, a bit.
No, it's not part of the process.
I know they ruined my life,
but they made me feel better than anything.
That's so stupid. I shouldn't even be a mom.
I should just give you guys Leo
and pretend none of this ever happened.
Don't you have somewhere to be?
♪ I can't help but stand out ♪
Oh, hey, um, weren't you supposed to be covering the ICU?
the speaking valve for the first time,
so Dr. Grey said she wanted to stay.
- ♪ Can't help but stand out ♪ - Hey.
♪ Tell me the rules so I can break them ♪
♪ I keep slippin' in their conversations ♪
The ball hasn't even dropped yet.
The ball can drop in our bed.
I did not mean that to sound so graphic.
Do you think I can ask him over
after his shift, like, for a toast maybe?
Uh, I mean, my son's with his father, so I don't know...
Oh, would Ben think that's a booty call?
He might think that's a booty call.
Well, maybe that's not such a bad thing.
Okay, hey, everyone! It's almost midnight!
- Oh, no, I'll take one. - Thank you.
Oh, you look... like I should've joined the Army.
♪ Cuz I'm gonna live my life free ♪
And may this year be everything you wish for.
We want to thank you all for...
How are you feeling off the vent?
And whether all your dreams came true this year,
Like I haven't breathed on my own
Garrett went to find us sparkling water
so we could pretend it's champagne.
- He's a good one, huh? - He is.
He was by your side the entire time.
He talked to me all day about you and the other doctors.
Shouldn't you be kissing one of them right now?
One of the doctors who likes you.
Garrett calls them Abercrombie and Stitch.
Kiss the one who turns back time for you.
♪ Feels like my heart will beat right out of my chest ♪
♪ This is as good as it gets ♪
Pulmonary... She has tolerated her speaking valve trials
We will remove the chest tube today.
PT/OT... She made it bed to chair.
Well, there has been a lot of progress.
We're still not out of the woods yet,
but, um, do you have any questions for us?
When do I get to eat?
She's been awake for 11 days, and she's been asking
Tacos are a ways away, I'm afraid.
But we can... We can do Jell-O.
The speech and swallow therapist will try that today.
I haven't seen you in a few days.
- How have you been? - Stood up.
I don't know if you've ever been stood up before,
- Well, I had a patient. - You have a phone.
The waiting. The build up. The game.
- That was just rude. - You're right.
And if that's what you're after, then I don't know.
Maybe Link is your guy after all.
A little more. A little more!
Please don't talk to me like I'm a child.
How do you know what "normal" is?
Have you ever had your spine carved open
can you give us a minute, please?
Richard, spare me the lecture about recovery.
- I know that's the pain talking. - No,
that is me talking, and I say she's a pain.
You're a pain in my entire ass!
I asked her to give me some exercises
so that I could get back to my sensual self,
like I'm some dried-up old mop.
Well, I'm sure that's not what she meant.
It's not like these pain meds
are letting me have any sexual appetite anyway.
Don't talk to me about time.
Hey, sorry I'm late. You already started.
This gel is really cold, and I have to get back to the pit.
You said we were gonna do these things together.
- You can't just... - What do you want me to do?
Every time I have to be a parent, wait for you?
Yeah, but if you say you're gonna wait, then you can't just...
This baby is gonna be outside of my body eventually.
Oh, really? Is that how it works?
Please explain it to me, Teddy.
This... This black ice is no joke.
- Did you put your snow tires on? - Uh, I will.
Ben, um, I need to tell you something...
I don't have the words ready, but my heart is.
I want you to come home, Ben.
I mean... it's lonely at the house when Tuck is gone,
and, uh, the fence, uh, it...
It blew down after the windstorm.
I haven't had a chance... No.
I'm not coming home just because now you're lonely
O-Okay, no, uh, that's not what I meant.
You know I haven't been myself.
I was working on my physical health so much
that I was ignoring my mental...
I-It wasn't the job, and it was not your fault.
Structure fire at Mercer and Fairview.
Pulmonary... she was placed back on the ventilator two days ago.
She's been awake for four weeks.
Why is she back on the ventilator?
She has pneumonia, so she's on antibiotics,
but her lungs have taken a pretty big hit.
GI... Her tube feeds were held for the O.R. today,
Am I... Are you still gonna...
We won't be able to reverse your ostomy today.
The CT that we got back,
it showed fluid collections in your abdomen,
which may be the source of your symptoms.
- What does that mean? - It means that
but it will be to clean out the fluid collections.
So you're gonna open her back up?
The wounds she's been working to heal for the last few weeks?
GU... She is on intermittent dialysis,
and she is going to have another session today.
Heme... she is on DVT prophylaxis.
I saw a bed. I laid down on it.
My feet are very angry with me.
Ah. I know what you need.
And I know just who to give it to you.
Why does it make perfect sense
that you have a favorite nail salon?
Well, you don't want to dig around somebody's brain
You ever want to experience pure bliss for $29...
Nicely done. You can do the next tie.
Yeah, and... And the other day,
when I asked you to change Natasha's central line,
you didn't mess it up at all.
Kind of a backhanded compliment, but thank you?
And he's hot, and he's confident,
And it's the most me I've ever felt in my whole life.
Well, I'm happy for you, Schmitt.
if not to share it with somebody, right?
Does that mean life is not worth living alone?
I think if you meet someone who lights you up,
Oh, God. That's really bad, right?
Last time I was here, she was talking about
Is that a... like, a boy? Does she have a boyfriend?
She didn't call him that, but I think so.
Um, and I'm on the one where you apologize for stuff
So, I have something to tell you guys.
I've been lying to you guys since I met you.
and my parents don't even know I'm here.
No, you've been talking to my friend Jerry.
I know I should've told you, but I was scared
if they found out about Leo.
Whoa. Hold on. They don't know about Leo?
I ran away when I got pregnant,
and they've probably been looking for me ever since.
- we have to call them now. - No.
And I'm scared if they know about Leo,
Neuro... I don't understand what's happening.
It feels like every step forward she makes,
I feel like I keep living the same day...
Let the doctors tell us what's going on.
The reason we think she had the dead bowel is that she's...
Okay, she's coding! I'm gonna start compressions!
Crack open the crash cart and let's push
one of atropine and one of epi.
Natasha! Schmitt, get him out of here.
Let's get an echo in here and start a heparin drip.
Well, when she had her pulmonary embolism 11 days ago,
it... it... it weakened her heart and her lungs.
And since then, her kidneys have worsened, as well.
Why is this happening to us?
- I don't have an answer for that... - Why is this happening to us?
If she dies, I die. If she dies, I die.
- Okay. - If she dies, I die.
Garrett. Listen to me. Look at me, please.
Look at me. Look at me. I'm here.
Look at me, please. Listen to me.
I know it feels like that right now, but trust me.
You have to fight for her.
She's in there fighting for you.
You don't get to give up.
So part of that fight is you're gonna go take a walk,
you're gonna take a shower, and you're gonna get a meal.
We will be here, fighting to keep her alive.
And you are gonna go fight to keep yourself alive.
♪ They don't love you like I love you ♪
♪ They don't love you like I love you ♪
♪ They don't love you like I love you ♪
So, do you think Britney's spelled with two "T" s or one?
Or maybe they spell it different,
like with a "Y" instead of "I", maybe?
We've been having this conversation for two weeks.
We just need to find them.
We need to tell them where their daughter is.
And have you thought about what you're gonna say to them
without going through the foster system,
and, oh, yeah, we have her son,
who you don't even know exists.
We at least need to tell the social worker.
Owen, she... she needs to make that call herself.
Why is she running our lives?
She's been lying to us, DCHS, everyone for months,
She's an addict. She's figuring it out.
This is all part of the disease. Betty is...
Sorry, I know that, yes, yes, addiction is a disease,
but since when does its symptoms include lying
and stealing from people who are trying to help you?
It just all feels like an excuse
for justifying piss poor life choices.
I'm sorry. That was way out of line.
You don't even see the line.
I don't know who I'm gonna be if they take Leo away.
I need to know sooner than later.
Hey. I have a pitch for tonight.
You know it's Valentine's Day, right?
I know. I'm trying new things.
I don't know how to make it better.
I just... I'm trying to do normal stuff, you know?
On the worst day of my mother's illness,
I wanted to take her IV and plunge it into my own arm.
Not just of that day or that moment.
I wanted out of this life.
It was a fleeting thought, but it came, and...
you know, that's how bad the pain was.
That's how bad the fear was.
My muscles shook in ways that I did not know
Yeah. Yeah, my eye's been twitching on and off all day.
where I can't hold a deep breath.
- Hey, can I ask you a question? - Yeah.
How can you stand there and tell Garrett to fight for love
when you're the one running away from it?
I have three kids and a big job.
I used to think you were so beyond me, but you're not.
You're like a kid playing hide and seek,
Do you want to go to dinner tonight?
Are you... asking me out... on Valentine's Day?
I'm not one to usually bang my head against a wall.
- Is that a no? - No, no.
It's my new thing, I guess.
You weren't supposed to see me.
Okay, it's my turn to say things now.
You said you wanted me to be happy,
and I did, just like you told me to.
And then you turned around and left me over it.
Now, I may be the one sleeping somewhere else,
No, you can't leave me like that again.
You can take all the... The job sabbaticals you want
and... and change your career a dozen times,
and I will be with you every step of the way.
But either we are in this together or we aren't.
And I never planned a version where we weren't.
I should've known something wasn't right with you.
I-I should've helped you get help.
I-I should've... I've seen it before.
When you had a heart attack, I promised you
I would build you a treehouse,
a place for you to go when you would worry,
when you felt overwhelmed, when you needed to be alone,
but I never followed through on that.
Now, Miranda, I-I need to know that this is not something
that you can call "time out" on ever again.
Well, then, yeah, I-I'm building you a treehouse.
It's, uh... It's not finished yet, but, uh...
I just figure, you know, once I move back in,
I can do a little bit of work on it every morning.
Dr. Schmitt said you had something
you want to discuss with us?
We've been in this hospital now for over three months.
Since then, Natasha's only gotten worse.
And I know you're the best doctors we could get
because I tried to find better ones,
They've been consulting palliative care doctors.
You all have done everything you can
to give me as much time as possible.
that wedding under the stars, but...
You gave us the rest of our lives together.
We need you to give verbal consent
So, once I shut the machine off,
I don't know how much time you'll have,
so we will give you meds to keep you comfortable.
Since when do we do Valentine's?
Since I've been an ass and needed an excuse to make it up to you.
I have a date, for which I cannot be late.
Hey, are you guys free to come to the ICU?
Your doctors wanted to make sure
we got our wedding under the stars.
Garrett asked me to read the vows
that you wrote before the accident.
I knew I would spend the rest of my life with you.
Before you, I never met anyone
"I could be in the same room with longer than a few hours."
"I waited my whole life to meet you.
I gave up thinking I ever would."
"Now that I found you, it all makes sense."
Everything that was once hard feels easy
now that you are in my life.
"And everything that was once easy is now sublime."
I'm sorry I've been so impossible.
No, no, you do not get to apologize, sweetheart.
I can't begin to understand what you're going through.
I'll be at your side while you do it.
You couldn't be average if you tried.
♪ No, I won't shed a tear ♪
Get me to that bedroom now.
Do you, Garrett, take this woman to be your wife?
And do you, Natasha, take this man to be your husband?
By the power vested in me,
I now pronounce you husband and wife.
Something always cuts our time short.
I'm supposed to be on a date.
So our best bet is to make the most of the time we have.

♪ I don't wanna hold it in ♪
Oh, oh, oh. This is better than sex.
Every pregnant woman I bring here says the same thing.

- Do you like? - Yeah, I like.
Or make up for lost time.
Did you want to keep waiting, or...?
Um, give me a glass of Lagavulin, neat...
But sometimes, if we're really lucky...
